definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Conclusions Thrush was well prevented with 2% sodium bicarbonate.
sentences.chinese: 結論2%碳酸氫鈉清洗口腔可預防鵝口瘡。

sentences.english: These can also be symptoms of less serious conditions such as thrush .
sentences.chinese: 這些也可以的症狀不太嚴重的條件，如鵝口瘡。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the effect of prevention of thrush by oral nursing with 2%sodium bicarbonate.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察2%碳酸氫鈉清洗口腔預防鵝口瘡的效果。

sentences.english: Zhou Zhuren prompted an oral candidiasis, also known as thrush.
sentences.chinese: 周主任提示這是一種口腔念珠菌感染，也稱鵝口瘡。

sentences.english: She has also had work published through Thrush Poetry Press.
sentences.chinese: 她還曾經鵝口瘡詩記者通過出版工作。

sentences.english: The discharge is thinner than thrush and has a characteristic odour.
sentences.chinese: 其釋放出的氣體比鵝口瘡淡，並有特殊的氣味。

sentences.english: Aphtha also can be divided for solid empty two kinds.
sentences.chinese: 口瘡也可分爲實虛兩類。

sentences.english: Using a spacer will also help reduce the possibility of thrush.
sentences.chinese: 利用儲藥罐也會減少發生鵝口瘡的可能。

sentences.english: Objective Discussion the therapy effect of Chinese medicine to RAU.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討中醫藥對複發性口瘡的療效。

sentences.english: According to my experience is that your child's mouth thrush .
sentences.chinese: 根據我的經驗您孩子嘴裏的是鵝口瘡。

sentences.english: I personally use it to effectively treat aphthas and caries in baby teeth.
sentences.chinese: 我個人用它來治療嬰兒牙齒的口瘡和齲病，效果顯著。

sentences.english: Xiao-yan tan came to the hospital own aphtha, happens to be Lin Wu Yang to see.
sentences.chinese: 譚小燕來到醫院治療自己的口瘡，恰好被林午陽看到。

sentences.english: Severe and persistent thrush should warn a possibility of AIDS.
sentences.chinese: 認爲嚴重而持久的鵝口瘡應警惕艾滋病。

sentences.english: Conclusion OHC might have certain application value in the treatment of ROAU.
sentences.chinese: 結論OHC治療複發性口瘡有一定的臨牀應用價值。

pinyin: feng1 shi1 xing4 guan1 jie2 yan2

definition: (of food) to retain in stomach due to indigestion (TCM)
injury such as contusion, sprain or fracture from falling, blow etc
bacterial tracheitis (inflammation of the windpipe, often caused by Staphylococcus aureus)/henpecked (a pun on 妻子管得严 used in comic theater)
impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
(TCM) plum-pit qi, a feeling of a lump in the throat (globus pharyngis) or of stagnant phlegm
